title: (x) Handwriting - FF Market {Mike Y}
content:
Anybody know what this handwriting font is?   
   
 ![Handwriting](http://web.archive.org/web/20051123013343im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/41896.gif)   
   
TIA
author: refusenik

comments.content:
The font is FF Market, designed by H. A. Simon in 1996.   
   
Here is the sample from Part 9 of the Script Font ID Guide:   
 ![Market sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20051123013343im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/41927.gif)

\> The font is FF Market   
   
So it is. Thanks, Mike!
Incidentally, is that your own sample sheet? If so, you might like to know that it should be "Zwieback" and not "Zweiback". For what it's worth...

Yes, that was one of the early samples made for me using the template that I gave people. The [Script Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20051123013343/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/ScriptIDGuide.html) was started in 2000, and it was quickly pointed out after a few months that I had the spelling wrong. It still works for ID purposes, and the newer samples have the right spelling.   
   
Thanks for mentioning it, though.
